Instrument.name: COSPIN-Anisotropy Telescope for U
Instrument.description: The COSPIN-Anisotropy Telescope (AT) on the Ulysses spacecraft measures the three-dimensional charged-particle distribution in energy ranges from 0.7 to 23.0 MeV for particles with Z ≥ 1 and protons. It consists of two identical telescopes, each with three silicon detectors, which are arranged at different angles (145° and 60°) to the spacecraft's spin axis. The telescopes use a passive aluminum collimator shield to define the acceptance angle and minimize contamination from low-energy particles. The data is processed into energy channels and sector-based outputs to study particle distributions and solar events. The instrument has shown good in-flight performance, providing reliable data during solar particle events. Calibration ensures accurate measurement of particle energies, and the system includes mechanisms to handle potential electronic failures.
